text: The Asssam-Tibet earthquake, also called the Assam earthquake, happened on 15 August 1950. The earthquake had a magnitude of 8.6. It killed 1,526 people. It was the 6th biggest earthquake of the 20th century. It is also the biggest earthquake on record that was not caused by an oceanic subduction. Instead, it was caused by two continental plates converging (crashing together). ==References== Category:1950 in Asia Category:1950s in China Category:1950s in India Category:Earthquakes in China Category:Earthquakes in Asia
